page.title: 09Tourism - General
page.content: Tourism is one of the major industries of the Lake District. The natural beauty of the region attracts many thousands of people from home and abroad every year who come to walk, climb, water ski, sail, or just enjoy the scenery. Windermere is within 20 minutes of the M6 motorway as well as being the rail terminus for the southern Lakes. As a result, it is a natural focus for visitors with many hotels of all categories, and bed and breakfast places in abundance, as shown in the statistical data. A lot of people use static or touring caravans, and camp sites are usually full in the main season. The main tourist office is situated near Windermere station and always eems to be busy, particularly helping to find accomodation.
